intro: Meibomia retinens, commonly known as the creeping meibomia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Meibomia retinens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
